name: difpr
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))

stmt.origin: eqtri(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)), cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))
-| wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))))
-| wceq(cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))
-| wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))))
-| wceq(cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))))
-| wceq(cpr(c1, c2), cun(csn(c1), csn(c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))
-| wceq(cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))
-| wceq(cpr(c1, c2), cun(csn(c1), csn(c2)))

|- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))
-| wceq(cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))

body.origin: |- wceq(cdif(c0, cun(csn(c1), csn(c2))), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))

cumulated.origin: |- wceq(cdif(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), cdif(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c2)))

comment: Removing two elements as pair of elements corresponds to removing each of the two elements as singletons. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 13-Jul-2018.)
